author: andreas
content: Yes, that's what I mean. For me, Go is much about balance and force fields, at least that's how it feels to me. Of course I can't really play. I've never tried playing against a good Go player. I learned the rules, played with some friends and won every single game. Then nobody wanted to play against me. I suppose I could not stand a game against even a slightly trained club player, but this intuition-based approach was at least successful enough against other beginners, that it completely killed off the game in my environment ðŸ™‚
